audio_description: Assalamu Alaikum. Welcome to Banal Poor’s Secret. Today, I’ll teach you a different recipe – a different kind of biryani that is very delicious and I’m sure you’ll love it. Let’s start making it together.

audio_description: Bismillahir Rahmanir Rahim. First, we’ll grind the spices for marination. I’m using 15-20 green chilies since I’m making biryani with around 1.5–2 kg of meat, so I’ve added extra chilies.

audio_description: As you can see, I’ve made a paste with green chilies, coriander, mint, and lemon juice. Now moving to the next step. In a bowl, I’ll add about one cup of yogurt since, as mentioned, we are using over a kilo of meat.

audio_description: We’re using beef with bone because as the meat cooks, juices come out from the bones which enhance the flavor. Be sure to include at least one or two pieces with bone.

audio_description: As you can see, the meat is well coated with the marinade. At this point, you can store it in different containers and freeze it for up to one month. Whenever you need to make biryani urgently, just defrost and use it.
